result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alonzo Tobias Flowers II

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alonzo Tobias Flowers II appeared in court.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status of counsel. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for casue to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing. Hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Alonzo Tobias Flowers II in court in person.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel. 
Court orders defendant to continue to comply with bail conditions: No possession of firearms/dangerous weapons, No driving without a valid license, No possession of controlled substance without a valid prescription.
Status conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT

Defendant Alonzo Tobias Flowers in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No driving without a valid license.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Alonzo Tobias Flowers in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/22/22 @ 1:30p
